gurmukhi: kw cuqrwnn mY blu hY joaU Awhv mY hm so iris kYhY ]kaun KgyS idnyS inSyS inhwr kY mon BjY hY ]
transliteration: Kaa Chaturaanan Mai Bal(u) Hai Jooo Aahav Mai Ham So Ris(i) Kai-hai|| Kaoun Khagesh Dinesh Nishesh Nihaar Kai Mon Bhajai Hai||
translation: “Does Brahma possess such strength that he may fight with me? What are the poor Garuda, Ganesh, Surya, Chandra etc.? All these will run away silently on seeing me;

gurmukhi: SyS jlyS suryS DnyS jU jau Air hY qaU moh n CYhY ]Bwjq dyv iblok kY mokau qU lrkw lir kw Plu lYhY ]1250]
transliteration: Shesh Jalesh Suresh Dhanesh Joo Jau Ar(i) Hai Taoo Moh Na Chhai-hai|| Bhaajat Dev Bilok Kai Mokau Too Larkaa Lar(i) Kaa Phal(u) Lai-hai||1250||
translation: “If Sheshanaga, Varuna, Indra, Kuber etc. resist me for some time, they will not harm me even slightly; the gods even run away on seeing me; you are still a child what will you gain by fighting with me?1250.

gurmukhi: Kyvq hY jIau ikh nimq qij rn sXwm pDwr ]mwrq hor n Awj quih Apny blih sMBwr ]1251]
transliteration: Khovat Hai Jeeo Kih Namit Taj(i) Ran Syaam Badhaar|| Maarat Hor Na Aaj Tuhe Apne Balah(i) Sanbhaar||1251||
translation: “O Krishna ! why are you bent upon losing your life? Leave the battlefield and run away; I shall not kill you today with my full strength.”1251.

gurmukhi: Aimt isMG ky bcn sun bolXo hir kir kop ]Ab Akwr quA lop kr Aimt isMG ibnu Ep ]1252]
transliteration: Amit Singh Ke Bachanndsoun Bolyo Har(i) Kar(i) Kop|| Ab Akaar Tua Lop Kar Ameet Singh Bin(u) Op||1252||
translation: Hearing the words of Amit Singh, Krishna was highly enraged and said, “O Amit Singh! I shall now destroy your body and make you lifeless.”1252.

gurmukhi: ju`Du krXo hirjU jug jwm qbY irp rIJ kY AYsy pukwrXo ]bwlk ho Ar ju`D pRbIn ho mwgu kCU muK jo ijX DwrXo ]
transliteration: Juddhu) Daryo Har(i) Joug Jaam Tabai Rip Reejh Kai Aise Poukdaryo|| Baalak Ho Ar Juddh Prabeen Ho Maag(u) Kacchoo Moukh Jo Jiya Dhdaryo||
translation: When Krishna fought for two Pahars (about six hours), the enemy Amit Singh got pleased and said, “O Krishna ! although you are still a child, but you are skillful in warfare; you may ask for whatever you want.”

gurmukhi: AwpnI pwq kI Gwq kI bwq kau dyhu bqwie murwr aucwrXo ]swmuih moih n koaU hnY As lY qb kwnH pCwvr JwrXo ]1253]
transliteration: Apanipaat Kighaat Kibaat Kau Deh(u) Bataae Muraar Ouchdaryo|| Saamuh(i) Moh(i) Na Ko( i)  Hanai As Lai Tab Kaahn Pchhaadar Jhdaryo||1253||
translation: Krishna said, “Tell me the manner of your death.” Then Amit Singh said, “No one can kill me from the front.” Then Krishna struck a blow on him behind.1253.

gurmukhi: sIs ktXo n htXo qh Taur qy daur kY AwgY hI ko pgu DwrXo ]kuMcru eyk huqo dl mY iqh Dwie kY jwie kY Gwie pHwrXo ]
transliteration: Sees Katyo Na Hatyo Tah Thaur Te Daur Kai Aagad Hiko Pag(u) Dhdaryo|| Kounchar(u) Ek Houto Dal Mai Tih Dhaae Kai Jaae Kai Hgade Prahdaryo||
translation: The head of Amit Singh was cut, but still he ran and moved forward and he struck a dreadful blow on an elephant of the army;

gurmukhi: mwr krI hin bIr clXo As lYkr sRI hir Er pDwrXo ]BUim igrXo isr sRI iSv lY gh muMf kI mwl ko myru svwrXo ]1254]
transliteration: Maar Karihan(i) Beer Chadyo As Laikar Srihar(i) Or Padhaayo|| Bhoom(i) Giryo Sir Srishiv Lai Gad Mounnd Kimaal Ko Mer(u) Savdaryo||1254||
translation: After killing the elephant and many warriors, he rushed forward towards Krishna; his head fell down on the ground, which was given a place of Meru by Shiva in his rosary of skulls.1254.
